item.title: Academic
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release (function defer() { if (window.jQuery) { jQuery(document).ready(function(){ GetLatestReleaseInfo(); }); } else { setTimeout(function() { defer() }, 50); } })(); function GetLatestReleaseInfo() { $.getJSON('https://api.github.com/repos/gcushen/hugo-academic/tags').done(function (json) { let release = json[0]; // let downloadURL = release.zipball_url; $('#academic-release').text('Latest release ' + release.name); }); }

About Me Hi, welcome to my website! I am a second year Ph.D. Student in Political Science at University of Maryland, College Park. I hold a Master degree in Political Science from the State University of Rio de Janeiro, and a JD in Law at Federal University of Para, Brazil. My research agenda is located at the intersection of political institutions and political behavior, with a regional focus in Latin America.

item.title: My work
item.description: My primary research interests are comparative political economy with focus on welfare institutions, redistributions and income inequality. For my dissertation project, I focus on the relationship between violence and welfare politics. Additionally, with Mariana Carvalho I have a working paper on political cycles of violence in Brazil, where using a unique dataset on political assassination in the country we research the conditions that triggers the use of violence on the electoral cycles in the country.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I have served as teaching assistant for the following undergraduate courses at University of Maryland, College Park. By clicking in each of the linkk, one goes to the github page I upladed the material I used ineach course. GVPT289: Politics in the Developing World GVPT282: Religion and Politics
